alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Newton; Pope; Searcy (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 04 at 1:03PM CDT until September 04 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Searcy County in north central Arkansas... Eastern Newton County in north central Arkansas... Northeastern Johnson County in western Arkansas... Northwestern Pope County in central Arkansas... * Until 145 PM CDT. * At 102 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Dillen, or 19 miles northeast of Clarksville, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Jasper... Dillen... Piercetown... Walnut... Bertha... Rosetta... Bass... Fort Douglas... Crossroad... Swain... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Gum Springs in Newton County... Nail... Lurton... Mineral Springs Recreation Area... Wayton... Low Gap... Parthenon... Vendor... Mt Judea... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
